items.text: I often feel that others should admire me for my achievements.
items.rationale: A strong desire for admiration is a key aspect of an admirable self-image.

items.text: People frequently tell me that I have a magnetic personality.
items.rationale: Being perceived as charismatic is central to an admirable self-image.

items.text: I believe I am destined for greatness.
items.rationale: A belief in one's own exceptional destiny is indicative of an admirable self-image.

items.text: I often think about how I can be the best in my field.
items.rationale: Striving for excellence and recognition is a hallmark of an admirable self-image.

items.text: I enjoy being the center of attention.
items.rationale: Seeking attention aligns with the need for admiration.

items.text: I feel that my talents are often overlooked.
items.rationale: Feeling underappreciated can stem from a strong self-image.

items.text: I am proud of my accomplishments and like to share them with others.
items.rationale: Pride in achievements is a component of an admirable self-image.

items.text: I often fantasize about being recognized for my contributions.
items.rationale: Fantasizing about recognition is linked to an admirable self-image.

items.text: I believe I have a special role to play in the world.
items.rationale: A sense of specialness is central to an admirable self-image.

items.text: I often feel that I am more capable than others.
items.rationale: Feeling superior in capability is part of an admirable self-image.

items.text: I like to be acknowledged for my unique qualities.
items.rationale: Desiring acknowledgment for uniqueness is linked to an admirable self-image.

items.text: I often feel that I deserve more respect than I receive.
items.rationale: Feeling deserving of respect is a component of an admirable self-image.

items.text: I sometimes think people don't appreciate my true value.
items.rationale: This could also relate to feelings of being undervalued, not just self-image.

items.text: I like to think of myself as a leader.
items.rationale: Leadership can be a part of self-image but also relates to social roles.

items.text: I sometimes feel that my ideas are more innovative than others'.
items.rationale: Could map to Cognitively Expansive due to focus on innovation.

items.text: I often come up with ideas that others find groundbreaking.
items.rationale: Generating groundbreaking ideas is a key aspect of cognitive expansiveness.

items.text: I enjoy exploring complex theories and concepts.
items.rationale: Interest in complex theories is indicative of cognitive expansiveness.

items.text: I frequently think about how things could be improved.
items.rationale: A focus on improvement and innovation is central to cognitive expansiveness.

items.text: I am always looking for new ways to solve problems.
items.rationale: Seeking novel solutions is a hallmark of cognitive expansiveness.

items.text: I often find myself lost in thought about abstract ideas.
items.rationale: Engagement with abstract ideas is a core facet of cognitive expansiveness.

items.text: I enjoy challenging the status quo with my ideas.
items.rationale: Challenging norms is indicative of cognitive expansiveness.

items.text: I often think about the future and what it could hold.
items.rationale: Future-oriented thinking is a component of cognitive expansiveness.

items.text: I like to think outside the box.
items.rationale: Thinking outside the box is a key aspect of cognitive expansiveness.

items.text: I often have insights that others find surprising.
items.rationale: Having surprising insights is indicative of cognitive expansiveness.

items.text: I enjoy discussing philosophical ideas.
items.rationale: Interest in philosophy is a component of cognitive expansiveness.

items.text: I often see connections between seemingly unrelated things.
items.rationale: Seeing connections is a hallmark of cognitive expansiveness.

items.text: I sometimes feel overwhelmed by the number of ideas I have.
items.rationale: Could also relate to anxiety or stress, not just cognitive expansiveness.

items.text: I like to think of myself as a visionary.
items.rationale: Visionary thinking can relate to self-image as well as cognitive expansiveness.

items.text: I sometimes use my charm to get what I want.
items.rationale: Could map to Interpersonally Exploitive due to manipulation aspect.

items.text: I often find ways to get others to do what I want.
items.rationale: Manipulating others to achieve personal goals is a key aspect of being interpersonally exploitive.

items.text: I am skilled at persuading people to see things my way.
items.rationale: Persuasion for personal gain is indicative of being interpersonally exploitive.

items.text: I often use my influence to get ahead.
items.rationale: Using influence for personal advancement is a hallmark of being interpersonally exploitive.

items.text: I know how to make people do what I want without them realizing it.
items.rationale: Subtle manipulation is a core facet of being interpersonally exploitive.

items.text: I can be very convincing when I need to be.
items.rationale: Being convincing for personal benefit is indicative of being interpersonally exploitive.

items.text: I often find myself using others to achieve my goals.
items.rationale: Using others for personal goals is a hallmark of being interpersonally exploitive.

items.text: I am good at getting people to do favors for me.
items.rationale: Getting favors through manipulation is a component of being interpersonally exploitive.

items.text: I often charm people to get what I want.
items.rationale: Using charm for personal gain is indicative of being interpersonally exploitive.

items.text: I know how to play people against each other to my advantage.
items.rationale: Playing people against each other is a key aspect of being interpersonally exploitive.

items.text: I often manipulate situations to benefit myself.
items.rationale: Manipulating situations for personal benefit is a hallmark of being interpersonally exploitive.

items.text: I am often able to get others to do things they wouldn't normally do.
items.rationale: Influencing others to act against their norm is indicative of being interpersonally exploitive.

items.text: I sometimes feel that I can easily influence others.
items.rationale: Influence can also relate to leadership, not just exploitation.

items.text: I like to think of myself as a master negotiator.
items.rationale: Negotiation skills can relate to both exploitation and legitimate influence.

items.text: I sometimes use my intelligence to outsmart others.
items.rationale: Could map to Cognitively Expansive due to focus on intelligence.
